results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.

results.title: My "perfect" family
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ebonie Sadler-Small and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Ebonie Sadler-Small grew up with her grandmother, she attributes her entire family to the inspiring youth leader she is today. Ebonie feels that in not having a conventional family, she has gained an non-judgemental, adventurous and optimistic outlook on life. With her family and friends, Ebonie has been encouraged and supported and she feels this has given her the strength and confidence to achieve in life.

results.title: Mwansa the Great
results.creator_credit: Rungano Nyoni, Gabriel Gauchet, ICreateFilms and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: A little boy sees himself as ‘Mwansa the great’, a full-grown warrior hunting lions. His little sister also visualises herself as an adult, ‘Princess Shula’ who is responsible for disciplining and looking after Mwansa.

results.title: Mutton birds
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
Aborigines gather eggs and hunt the mutton bird on small coastal islands. The birds are removed from their burrows, killed and plucked before being loaded onto bark floats to be carried through the surf back to the camp fire.

results.title: Mutton and gold
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. The change from a Provincial Georgian culture into Victoriana when free settlers and ‘mutton and gold’ changed everythingin Australia including its art. Works include T.S. Gill on the goldfields, the vast history of painting of William Strutt and the landscapes of Eugene von Guerard, Nicholas Chevalier, William Piguenit, S.T. Gill and Louis Buvelot. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mutiny on the Western Front
results.creator_credit: Brian Morris, Mingara Films, Australian Film Commission and Richard Dennison
results.brief_description: Australian veterans of the Great War revisit scenes of famous battles in France and Belgium. Tells the story of the Australian involvement using archival film and comment from war historians. Shows the change of attitude to war and the feelings that led some men in the Ist Battalion to mutiny in September 1918. Also reveals the public opinion and politics of the time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Morris, Mingara Films, Australian Film Commission and Richard Dennison

results.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
results.creator_credit: Irving G. Thalberg, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Frank Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical swashbuckler retells the story of William Bligh and Fletcher Christian, two seamen who clashed on the high seas in 1789. In this account (one of many) Captain Bligh is depicted as a ruthless and sadistic leader whose eagerness to suppress the men’s insurrection leads to brutal judgments. First Mate Christian, enraged after the death of the ship’s doctor, leads a mutiny against Bligh who is set out to sea, with forty-eight others in an open boat. Against all likelihood, Bligh survives and returns to seek revenge on Christian. Winner of Best Film at the 1935 Academy Awards and a huge box office success, historians questioned the accuracy of the script which created a classic arch screen villain in Bligh, countered by a saintly Christian (who reputedly captured Tahitians for slaves). Despite these quibbles however, the setting (filmed at great expense on location in Tahiti) and fine cinematography, as well as the stellar key performances, make the film a highly enjoyable, swashbuckling, adventure film.
